report_title: IBISWorld | Backpack & Courier Bag Manufacturing in the US Mar 2023
executive_summary: Backpack and courier bag manufacturers make backpacks, outdoor packs and courier bags. These products are used for school, work, sports and outdoor activities. Operators benefited in the years immediately preceding the pandemic, as massive wage growth and high incomes boosted spending on the industry's products. COVID-19 led to school closures, which reduced demand for school bags, causing revenue to creep downward in 2020. As consumers became more concerned about viruses, they sought outdoor activities that involved little human interaction, such as hiking. Surging demand for outdoor activities increased spending on technical packs, significantly contributing to revenue growth. Inflation has constrained households' budgets in recent years, causing consumers to prioritize necessities over wants, so spending on outdoor packs and fancy courier bags has declined, disrupting manufacturers' performance.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising incomes and wages boosted revenue growth before the pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In the years right before COVID-19, the US economy was strong, per capita disposable income increased steadily, and wage growth was the highest in decades. Backpacks and courier bags are often used for discretionary activities, so demand for the industry's products surged when consumers had lots of extra income, aiding the industry.

When the pandemic hit, people quarantined or engaged in social distancing, so many schools operated virtually. Since students weren't physically traveling to school, demand for backpacks declined, causing revenue for the industry to fall slightly in 2020. As restrictions were lifted in 2021, schools began operating exclusively in-person again, increasing the need for backpacks and boosting revenue.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: High demand for outdoor activities has provided a major source of revenue for manufacturers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: COVID-19 caused consumers to reduce spending on most things, but demand for outdoor activities soared. Since many individuals flocked to the countryside during the pandemic, they wanted to hike and do other outdoor activities involving little human interaction. Demand for technical packs has skyrocketed because of more spending on outdoor activities, spurring revenue growth during the current period.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Inflation has constrained the budgets of consumers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Inflation has reached record highs recently, reducing households' purchasing power. Since more individuals must make conscious financial decisions to put food on the table, discretionary spending has declined. Since backpacks and courier bags are mostly considered "wants," demand for them has declined amid high inflation, disrupting the industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Technological progress is continuing to revolutionize education, as e-books are becoming integral to learning since they contain lots of information and are easy to carry. As more students use electronics for textbooks, notebooks and readings, backpacks will become less necessary, disrupting demand for a major product created by manufacturers. Operators can try to preserve their revenue by encouraging students to purchase courier bags to carry their electronics used for schoolwork.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Less physical activity will disrupt downstream demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As sedentary activities (e.g., watching videos, playing video games) become more popular, the population will become less active and healthy, demonstrated by a rising obesity rate. As more people become less active, demand for outdoor activities will plunge. Less interest in outdoor activities will cause sales for sporting goods stores to fall, reducing downstream demand for manufacturers and disrupting the industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Higher incomes and exports will provide some relief for operators
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite challenges resulting from a more sedentary society, manufacturers will benefit from rising per capita disposable income, as some consumers that enjoy physical activity will use their extra money to purchase technical packs and other materials. As the US dollar depreciates, consumers in other countries will find domestically produced goods less expensive, enabling US-based companies to export their products. Since exporting goods will be easier, operators can get revenue from consumers abroad that prefer physical activity.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Operators hope that innovations will create new revenue sources
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Backpack and courier bag manufacturers have been adapting their products to the times, which include backpacks that charge phones and courier bags that stop theft. Companies hope that these better products will encourage consumers to want their products, stemming some of the decline in revenue from the loss of interest in physical activity and the decreased usefulness of schoolbags.

industry_definition: The Backpack & Courier Bag Manufacturing industry comprises establishments that primarily manufacture backpacks, courier bags, duffel bags, fanny packs, knapsacks and tote bags from materials such as canvas, leather, nylon, polyester and other synthetic materials.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Business professionals in industries like finance, insurance and sales demand courier bags.
People who participate in outdoor activities like hiking, skiing and mountain climbing drive demand for technical backpacks.

products_and_services.product_description: Bags designed for carrying documents and materials for business professionals.
Backpacks designed for outdoor activities like hiking, climbing and skiing.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Business professionals demand courier bags, so backpack and courier bag manufacturers have a significant presence in regions with major business-oriented industries like finance, insurance and sales.

The popularity of outdoor activities like hiking, skiing and mountain climbing in regions like New England and the Rocky Mountains boosts demand for technical packs from backpack and courier bag manufacturers.

business_locations.location_description: The Mid-Atlantic region contains major cities such as New York, Philadelphia and Washington, DC, home to major industries such as finance, insurance and sales. Employees in these industries demand courier bags, so backpack and courier bag manufacturers are prevalent in the region.

New England and the Rocky Mountains region are known for their mountain ranges and forests, where hiking, skiing, mountain climbing and other activities are popular. High demand for these activities boosts spending on technical packs, so the industry has a significant presence in these regions.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The industry faces moderate environmental regulations related to the use of chemicals, dyes and other materials in manufacturing processes. Companies must ensure proper disposal and treatment of hazardous waste.
Backpacks and bags must meet product safety standards set by the Consumer Product Safety Commission to protect against potential hazards like lead content or small parts that could be a choking risk.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Becoming a backpack and courier manufacturer doesn't require any specialized license. Still, most states will force the entrant to provide necessary identification and proof of no criminal record to ensure that business is conducted properly. Potential operators also must consider the costs of the regulations that they must follow before setting up operations.

As in most manufacturing industries, start-up costs for physical capital are hefty. The potential entrant must purchase a factory, office spaces and machinery that constructs the bags. They also must pay the first workers that they hire.

basis_points.basis_description: There's a significant amount of differentiation in this industry, as companies with well-established brands already have a loyal customer base. Since manufacturers sell a diverse slew of products and innovation is always happening, potential entrants can still overcome brand loyalty.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Operators have been updating their products, such as making courier bags more secure and adding chargers to outdoor packs. These innovations will encourage some manufacturers to enter the industry as a means of capturing another revenue stream.

concentration_points.concentration_title: As entry into the industry increases, consolidation becomes more difficult.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Large backpack and courier bag manufacturers have lots of funds, so they can afford to acquire other companies. Acquisitions will enable large operators to master the selling of their merchandise to consumers directly, increasing the volume of their sales and market share.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In 2023, purchases are forecast to make up 45.2% of revenue. Purchase costs include cotton, fibers, leather, zippers and other materials that operators buy when making their products. Purchases haven't changed significantly as a percentage of revenue, as input costs for many items have remained steady. Some inputs (e.g., cotton) have increased amid disrupted supply chains, but companies can pass on some of these costs to consumers, enabling purchase costs to remain level.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: The pandemic recovery spurs growth in profit
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In 2023, profit is expected to comprise 4.7% of revenue. The recovery from COVID-19 led to a surge in consumer spending, as Americans were flush with cash since the government gave out significant aid during the pandemic. Since backpacks and courier bags are discretionary items, surging consumer spending boosted revenue, which caused profit to creep upward during the current period.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages decline slightly amid rising automation
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages are anticipated to comprise 22.5% of revenue in 2023. Backpack and courier bag manufacturing is a fairly labor-intensive industry, as designing bags requires some human input. Technological progress has enabled repetitive processes to become automated, reducing the need for some workers and causing wages to creep downward as a percentage of revenue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Profit has increased amid the surge in consumer spending
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Profit has increased amid the surge in consumer spending. Individuals increased their spending significantly following COVID-19, as they had money from stimulus checks and other forms of aid. Since backpacks and courier bags are mostly discretionary purchases, soaring consumer spending has boosted revenue and profit.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Backpack and courier bag manufacturing is a labor-intensive industry
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Backpack and courier bag manufacturing is a labor-intensive industry, but wages have declined as a percentage of revenue in recent years. Innovation has automated some repetitive processes, reducing the need for some workers.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue volatility in the backpack and courier bag manufacturing industry is moderate. While demand is tied to consumer spending levels, which can fluctuate with economic conditions, backpacks and bags are still needed for school, work and travel purposes even during downturns.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Technological progress has enabled repetitive processes in backpack and bag manufacturing to become automated, reducing the need for some workers and causing wages to decline as a percentage of revenue.

FAQs.question: What is the profit margin for the backpack and courier bag manufacturing industry?
FAQs.answer: The profit margin is expected to be 4.7% in 2023, which is lower than the sector average.

FAQs.question: What is the average wage in the industry?
FAQs.answer: The average wage in 2023 is forecast to be $48,958, which is higher than the sector average.

FAQs.question: What is the largest cost component for the industry?
FAQs.answer: The largest cost component is purchases at 45.2% of revenue in 2023.

FAQs.question: What key trends are impacting industry costs?
FAQs.answer: Purchase costs have remained relatively flat as a percentage of revenue. Profit has increased due to surging consumer spending following the pandemic recovery. Wages have declined slightly as a percentage of revenue amid rising automation.

FAQs.answer: The report provides detailed data on financial ratios like EBIT/revenue, EBITDA/revenue, leverage ratio, liquidity ratios, coverage ratios, leverage ratios, operating ratios and more over multiple time periods like 3-year, 5-year and 10-year averages.

FAQs.answer: The report provides historical and forecast data on metrics like revenue per employee, revenue per enterprise, employees per establishment, average wage, wages as a percentage of revenue, establishments per enterprise, IVA/revenue, imports/demand, and exports/revenue over multiple years.
